description: End users may experience potential exposure of sensitive information after installing the security update associated with CVE-2024-30096. Specifically, if an attacker successfully exploits this vulnerability, they could gain unauthorized access to cryptographic secrets like keyguard (kg) keys utilized to protect sensitive data. This unauthorized access could lead to the decryption of various confidential information, significantly risking the security of the affected systems. Systems running affected builds of Windows 10 (versions 22H2 and 21H2) and Windows 11 (versions 23H2, 22H2, and 21H2), as detailed in the KB article KB5039212 and KB5039211, should be monitored closely for any signs of such information disclosure. The significance of this issue is categorized as important due to the potential catastrophic consequences of data exposure.
